result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Krista M Dillon not in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter John Heflin in court for Krista M Dillon.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Held off the record. Defense requested date for Plea/Sentencing. Parties selected date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Krista M Dillon not in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter John Heflin in court for Krista M Dillon.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting an additional status. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Krista M Dillon in court with Attorney Peter John Heflin; both appear by video.  Defendant Krista M Dillon in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: River Hills Police Officer Matthew Spoerl. Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior OWI convictions.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Peter John Heflin in court by video, defendant Krista M Dillon not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Ms Dillion is not available by video from Ozaukee for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Krista M Dillon not in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
No appearance by defendant, Court waives appearance and orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Krista M Dillon in court.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

A $2500 signature bond was previously signed, but no entry was made on the record. The bond was amended to $5,000 signature bond.
No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Krista M Dillon in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
